snippet: Strengthened exports to the United States may increase trade frictions as White House and Chinese Politburo contenders engage in political grandstanding.
abstract: China’s exports to the United States and Southeast Asia rise in September while country’s money supply expanded faster than expected; exports also tend to signal that American retailers expect fairly robust sales at Christmas, as goods for late autumn sales tend to leave Chinese docks in September and October.
lead_paragraph: Strengthened exports to the United States may increase trade frictions as White House and Chinese Politburo contenders engage in political grandstanding.

headline.main: China Exports Rise, Hinting at a Glimmer of a Revival
headline.print_headline: China Exports Rise, Hinting at a Glimmer of Revival
